messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion]Was The Radical Fringe/ now: next year's conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/1/2003 2:34:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Kathryn s already worked that out---just in case HSC wants Sandra back again!  But YOU
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/1/2003 2:34:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
pamsoroosh@... writes:

> And please please pretty please plan around the HSC conference in
> Sacramento, if at all possible - I'd love to come to yours - I REALLY
> want to come - but I'd have to give my own state conference first
> priority because my kids will want to go there to see all their friends.

Kathryn's already worked that out---just in case HSC wants Sandra back again!
<G>

But YOU might be tired again! <BWG>

There won't be a clash! Promise!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion]Was The Radical Fringe/ now: next year's conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/1/03 12:35:39 PM, pamsoroosh@mac.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/1/03 12:35:39 PM, pamsoroosh@... writes:

<< And please please pretty please plan around the HSC conference in
Sacramento, if at all possible - I'd love to come to yours - I REALLY
want to come - but I'd have to give my own state conference first
priority because my kids will want to go there to see all their friends.

-pam
>>

If it could be planned for after the Olympics, that might help too.
Holly and I have a partial possible offer of a trip to London (Holly's way
paid, mine paid by me) to watch a toddler while the family goes to Greece.
We're Plan B, but I had to say "That's the homeschooling conference month!"

I don't know if enough families watch Olympic TV coverage to make that a
factor, but it hasn't been a factor for Kelly because it wasn't an Olympic year.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion]Was The Radical Fringe/ now: next year's conference
messages.msgSnippet: And please please pretty please plan around the HSC conference in Sacramento, if at all possible - I d love to come to yours - I REALLY want to come - but I d
messages.messageBody:
And please please pretty please plan around the HSC conference in
Sacramento, if at all possible - I'd love to come to yours - I REALLY
want to come - but I'd have to give my own state conference first
priority because my kids will want to go there to see all their friends.

-pam


On Tuesday, July 1, 2003, at 09:24 AM, Kelli Traaseth wrote:

> **plan NOW to come to MA for next year's in August!**
>
>
> Kathryn,
>
> You don't have any dates yet for that do you? I was wondering what
> part of August you're looking at. I think we might plan a little
> trip up to Canada(PEI) after. I'm already trying to pull a new
> homeschooler with me to MA, she's teterring toward unschooling! <g>
> This week she mentioned that she wanted to go to Prince Edward Island
> the beginning of September and I said, "well, you should come to the
> next unschooling conference! And we can go up after that!". My
> conniving little mind.
>
> Kelli~who is still counting down the days 'til this year's one. 45
> days until we leave!
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion]Was The Radical Fringe/ now: next year's conference
messages.msgSnippet: **plan NOW to come to MA for next year s in August!** Kathryn, You don t have any dates yet for that do you?   I was wondering what part of August you re
messages.messageBody:
**plan NOW to come to MA for next year's in August!**


Kathryn,

You don't have any dates yet for that do you? I was wondering what part of August you're looking at. I think we might plan a little trip up to Canada(PEI) after. I'm already trying to pull a new homeschooler with me to MA, she's teterring toward unschooling! <g> This week she mentioned that she wanted to go to Prince Edward Island the beginning of September and I said, "well, you should come to the next unschooling conference! And we can go up after that!". My conniving little mind.

Kelli~who is still counting down the days 'til this year's one. 45 days until we leave!

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
